page.title: 07LAKE ULLSWATER
page.content: LAKE ULLSWATER IS ENGLANDS SECOND LARGEST LAKE.MANY PEOPLE COME AND DO A LARGE AMOUNT OF WATER ACTIVITES LIKE CANOEING WINDSURFING AND FISHING. QUITE ALOT OF PEOPLE GO ON THE LAKE STEAMERS. THEY USUALLY GO TO HOWTOWN ON THE STEAMER AND WALK BACK ALONG THE LAKE SHORE. THE LAKE IS ABOUT 210 FEET DEEP. WE GET QUITE ALOT OF FISHERMEN AROUND HERE. THE FISHES IN THE LAKE ARE MOSTLY TROUT. NEAR THE SHORE THERE ARE QUITE ALOT OF LITTLE MINNOWS. MOST OF THE BOATS ON THE LAKE ARE YACHTS AND MOTOR BOATS. THE LAKE HAS ALOT OF LITTLE ISLANDS IN IT.
